page.title: 01WYKE GENERAL
page.content: Our area is a mixture of town and country, ranging from the townships of Wyke and Low Moor in the east, to small scattered farms and villages such as Norwood Green and Coley. Wyke was mentioned in the original Domesday Book as part of Bierley, and comprised a few isolated farms. Although the ownership of the land changed many times, the whole area remained undeveloped until the Industrial Revolution when the Low Moor Iron Company, and others, exploited the iron and coal which was readily available. Remains of old tramways and bell pits can still be found in Judy Woods and, together with the dilapidated iron and steel works at Low Moor, these are all that remains of a once important iron trade which supplied cannons for the Napoleonic Wars.
